1.brief: from out, out from among, from
1.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
a messenger, generally a (supernatural) messenger from God, an angel, conveying news or behests from God to men.
(I talk, chatter in classical Greek, but in NT a more dignified word) I speak, say.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
(denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
(originally: hither, hence) (a) exclamatory: come, (b) temporal: now, the present.
I point out, show, exhibit; met: I teach, demonstrate, make known.
(a) a judgment, a verdict; sometimes implying an adverse verdict, a condemnation, (b) a case at law, a lawsuit.
a prostitute; met: an idolatrous community.
large, great, in the widest sense.
I sit, am seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside.
